acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court records from Goochland County Circuit Court.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Woodson, Perkins, and Company was a coal company located in Goochland County, Virginia, that conducted business during the mid-nineteeth century. It consisted of John S. Woodson, Thomas J. Perkins, D.W.K. Bowles, and Stephen P. Hughes.
The journal was used as an exhibit in the chancery suit Executrix of John S. Fleming versus Creditors of John S. Fleming, heard in the Goochland County Circuit Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Woodson, Perkins, and Company Journal, 1843-1850, records the coal company's financial transactions including expenses paid by company and purchases made by customers. Information found includes date of transaction, form of transaction, amount owed and paid. Most transactions involved coal.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For additional information see the Goochland County Chancery Cause, Administrator of John S. Woodson versus Creditors of John S. Woodson. It can be found in the Local Records Collection at the Library of Virginia. The index number is 1866-009.
